Naraneus Domain.name: Naraneus Domain
Naraneus Domain.description:
The mistress of poison and arachnids that lords over the feared drow of Aventyr's underworld bestows special gifts upon her servants, granting them the prowess in both spell and deed to withstand the rigors of the treacherous life in the cut-throat society of drow... and beyond.

Sapper.name: Sapper
Sapper.description:
There are plenty of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.qkE6svtPYexKbbHL]{dvergr} with a penchant for destruction, but no affinity whatsoever for deep badgers or similar animals, and these studious soldiers take a different approach to underworld warfare, caving in tunnels and burying foes by the dozens on their way paved with explosive ambersticks.

Sapper Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.DcAdIDBClNBsJpHq]{Amberstick Sapper} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.9nYYsZgpHf2qRS0L]{The Eternal Amberstick}

7th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.wMGScFH374yCQcJT]{Ambercaps} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.PqpapT06nRdXwFWf]{Cave-in Master} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.EAIeISgtFJ5xibJr]{Improved Ambersticks}

10th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.O6JnTu2tqlZqE63a]{Amberstick Phase}

Circle of the Mushroom.name: Circle of the Mushroom
Circle of the Mushroom.description:
Druids of the circle of the mushroom are mellow protectors of the fungal jungles. Their order gathers amid clouds of spores, stumbling through the deepest, most toxic clouds, sustained by visions of strange alternate realities, the very essence that ties these druids to a nature both more wondrous and strange than regular mortals can perceive.

Circle of the Mushroom Features

2nd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.fCNHW1bTOVCMwRKI]{Truth of the Mushrooms} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.luEKKueR0pag2wsH]{Wild Shape: Explosive Caps}

6th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.LSKud7lpPwc2Bhhj]{Flurry of Mushrooms} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.5Yb7pBmJcVMUHkBD]{Mushroom Immunity}

10th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.gPzfn9B1Isdv7IFp]{Spell-powered Caps}

14th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.xiw662TURAflixiN]{Explosive Belch (15' Cone)} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.wVSQ1EmLsq85l2DZ]{Explosive Belch (60' Cone)}

Underminer.name: Underminer
Underminer.description:
Riding your dread @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.monsters-urc.R4wdTNtfCgB3PF5h]{Deep Badger} into battle, you are a fearsome foe to behold that can charge through the very earth and even rock to break your foes.

Underminer Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.7qTbHfzOBzzRrvSx]{Deep Badger Companion}

7th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.sayPlFY3vJvJk4TD]{Erupting Charge}

Mushroom Domain.name: Mushroom Domain
Mushroom Domain.description:
The massive, strange mushroom-jungles pulse with an inherent energy that is considered to be a kind of anima mundi suffusing all, its power springing from the massive, gorgeous jumble of colors, spores and life pulsing eternally in the underworld. The propagation of these places and the protection of their biomes have become nigh-rapturous experiences for some of the devout, with enlightenment beckoning in the hallucinogenic spores, teas and armors crafted from the very mushrooms themselves.

Mushroom Domain Spells

Cleric LevelSpells
1st@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.spells-urc.jOFMDsZ5MjTZ1818]{medicinal mushrooms} @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.gMrWeG8fMDPRFiVe]{entangle}

Crystal Cannonade.name: Crystal Cannonade
Crystal Cannonade.description:
The offspring of the colloid quickly learned to adapt to the terrestrial Aventyrian weapons, and the crossbow was the first the alien collective was to fully embrace. These inexplicable warriors turn the weapons into otherworldly devices that fire slivers of crystal that slam into objects, but strangely melt into living creatures.

Crystal Cannonade Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.lv47clkgcXPOYcUu]{Bonus Proficiencies} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.fw5aSWUAXAK7PiQf]{Crystalline Crossbows}

6th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.v4NcmyxPh0xmIMNU]{Crystalline Shrapnel}

11th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.qUwUX0YqJ9IUydLU]{Lethal Crystal Bursts}

17th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.w6HS3ELtVLOjRYE8]{Crystalline Barrage}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.kyH0qF2N1hHPLiOh]{Reaving Tradition} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Bonus Proficiencies (Crystal Cannonade).title: Bonus Proficiencies (Crystal Cannonade)
Bonus Proficiencies (Crystal Cannonade).hint: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with light, hand and heavy crossbows.

Innate Power.name: Innate Power
Innate Power.description:
Most common among the dwarven races, some stonespeakers draw their power from their own bodies, channeling the powers of the earth through their very beings. These stonespeakers sometimes belong to established martial traditions or orders, while other times, they are at a complete loss to explain their unique powers.

Innate Power Features

1st Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.dF14ohuBWZ8f2Y07]{Bonus Proficiency} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.kMDfCtQQLjDgiaEF]{Armor of Stone}

6th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ya5gRYJKjoocmNoM]{Shard Growth}

9th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.tvGCv6ZcSJ0PZdCB]{Stone Spikes}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Blind Duelist.name: Blind Duelist
Blind Duelist.description:
@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.9hk0MrqI67lCzCBG]{Vestraadi} fighters are known for being truly devastating opponents in duels, learning to focus on single enemies with an almost supernatural level of precision.

Blind Duelist Features

Reaving Vortex.name: Reaving Vortex
Reaving Vortex.description:
Some colliatur reavers learn to grow razor-sharp filament wires from their bodies, whipping them around with a flick of the wrist, standing immovable in a vortex of destruction as the filament-wires cut apart any opposition.

Reaving Vortex Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.D3ZThzktnr5oVmok]{Reaver's Filaments}

6th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.j8mWJmM260FD3dQJ]{Filament Superiority}

11th Level: Additional filament die

17th Level: Additional filament die

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.kyH0qF2N1hHPLiOh]{Reaving Tradition} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.B7xkZEX227xgYANu]{Colliatur Reaver}

Maneuvers.title: Maneuvers
Maneuvers.hint: You learn two maneuvers of your choice.

Oath of Destruction.name: Oath of Destruction
Oath of Destruction.description:
The Oath of Destruction binds a dour destroyer wholly to the process of destroying what mortals and gods have wrought. Many who swear this oath have lost fortunes, masterpieces and items of utmost importance, realizing the futility of even the most magical of items.

Tenets of Destruction

Though the exact words and strictures of the oath vary, dour destroyers of this oath share these tenets:

I shall not create, for all shall be dust. Dour destroyers are agents of dissolution and destruction, and creation, whether of items, houses or anything else, is anathema to them.

I place no value on baubles and fleeting flesh, for all is dust. Dour destroyers are expected to lead a minimalist lifestyle; while gorging oneself on the spoils of war is perfectly acceptable, the constant disintegration of finery, jewels etc. just shows the ephemeral nature of being and vices should never be the focus of their quests.

There is no beauty, only dust. Dour destroyers are expected to destroy art and means of creating art when they encounter it; anything that lifts the spirits of others is a hindrance towards the eventual transition to dust.

Oath of Destruction Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.6yEir8d1X65uMou9]{Devouring Instrument}

7th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.0CmXr2UV4ya9vIQb]{Improved Devouring Instrument}

15th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.XvQh8RdnaMuitGOc]{Greater Devouring Instrument}

20th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.OeZBUrj6ajDtggTC]{Legendary Devouring Instrument}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ORrfXo4wpxSMNe43]{Oath of the Endtimes} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.0D765UbqDBnlnFO6]{Dour-Destroyer}

Fortune's Smith.name: Fortune's Smith
Fortune's Smith.description:
YOU DON'T LIKE THE PAULDRONS?! My craft is not just a creation of tools—with each stroke, I bend the flow of fate itself. So take my goods as an investment into your destiny! If we are to adventure together, you'll soon see why I insist—now quit your whining and let's slay this dragon!

The archetypical fortune's smith is unlike most fighters in that he can make his allies more adept and flexible via his gorgeous craftsmanship.

Fortune's Smith Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.XaCsSQ8Dnwqv62IP]{Bonus Proficiencies} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.aWkIotnftg3JJxaS]{My Own Fortune}

7th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.gLilNX0XjfzmYFck]{Shared Fortune}

18th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ae9FWFZSX0nRwqx2]{Superior Fortunate Flexibility}

Smithkin.name: Smithkin
Smithkin.description:
Those who emulate the archetypical @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.5cjl06fRFIGDcZ7X]{dweorg} fighting smith epitomize the traditional image of their fighting style.

Smithkin Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.WW97cWeTjikBQKkD]{Dweorg Prowess}

7th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.NmzQssw9nqVjprL6]{Strength of the Forge}, Maneuvers

10th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.abdopBmFsULp1oIc]{Improved Dweorg Prowess}, Maneuvers, Forge Dice upgrade

18th Level: Forge Dice upgrade

 

Maneuvers

@UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.mnHQ66yyUTDWX925]{Bellows Blast} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.MZzucqZXJpNVUihZ]{Burning Assault} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JY3R7d54tTG7mCJX]{Endurance of the Forge}

Forge Dice.title: Forge Dice
Forge Dice.hint: You have four forge dice, which are d8s. A forge die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended forge dice when you finish a long or short rest. You gain an additional forge die at 7th and 15th level.

Maneuvers.title: Maneuvers
Maneuvers.hint: You learn two maneuvers of your choice. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You learn two additional maneuvers at 7th, 10th and 15th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.

Divine Calling.name: Divine Calling
Divine Calling.description:
Your mastery of stone and rock stems from being chosen by a deity or nature itself. Most often, stonespeakers with this stone lore are respected members of a tradition of chosen stewards and shepherds of subterranean communities, though exceptions exist—lone, grizzled survivors of the underworld have been known to exhibit stonespeaker powers after prolonged exposure to the magical geodes deep within the lightless depths, their powers stemming from an instinctual communion with nature itself.

Divine Calling Features

1st Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.JcrNJfHJjjo0C7Qr]{Wrath of the Earth}

6th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Q3DyCXhheft14VCC]{Riddle of Stones}

9th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Se8C9FtVMNnrzpDI]{Embrace of the Earth}

17th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.5vrRe8UspHiGjQAX]{Chosen of the Earth}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Geomancer.name: Geomancer
Geomancer.description:
You have studied arcane theorems related to stone and earth and learned to utilize it as a lethal force against your foes. Most geomancers are either scholars or people who have studied in one of the underworld's academies and arcane schools to become a stonespeaker.

Geomancer Features

1st Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.rJeNMNdGXLfEY2Zo]{Grasp of the Earth}

6th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.hf03D0xP4Josiveo]{Exploding Pebble}

9th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.2aPn9YJ0RfSU7L48]{Stone Telekinesis}

17th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.1qRTEOyJd7mleiPz]{Geomancer's Storm}

See also: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.ZSDhWgDJLrngTsYo]{Stone Lore} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.classes-urc.lN0n2x74lfWahLZh]{Stonespeaker}

Underworld Monstrosity.name: Underworld Monstrosity
Underworld Monstrosity.description:
Underworld Monstrosity Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.0PptTkgfQPOELLrf]{Mutation Surge}

Ahool Keener Domain.name: Ahool Keener Domain
Ahool Keener Domain.description:
You hear that creepy caterwauling? Sounds like keening, right? Don't be fooled—they make these noises as they vanquish their foes, so move—they're coming closer!

There is fascination in blood and those that consume it—from decadent nobles to savage cultures, there seems to be a primeval fascination associated with the drinkers of blood. It should come as no surprise, then, that the ahoolings not only have their own clergy with their hunting laments, but that some non-ahoolings follow this path as well.

Ahool Keener Domain Spells

Cleric LevelSpells

College of The Mirthful Mariachi.name: College of The Mirthful Mariachi
College of The Mirthful Mariachi.description:
The Mirthful Mariachi (Bard College)

Bards of the mirthful mariachi "college" (the art is almost never actually taught and comes naturally to most practitioners) feel the droning and vibrating rhythm of the underworld in the strings of their guitars. In love with both their ranged expertise, scouting and the melodies they use to bring the tunes of their strange home to life, these bards are tinkerers and vagabonds, blending their expertise with ranged weapons with a keen ear and a wide smile.

College of the Mirthful Mariachi Features

The Soul Burner.name: The Soul Burner
The Soul Burner.description:
And then, we saw him—the tyrant of the lower tunnels, surrounded by a circle of candles—and as we approached, all hell broke loose. Literally.

Among the gitwerc, there are some practitioners of the arcane arts that have fully embraced the practice of fashioning @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.items-urc.7YsREErrFT0eUJSn]{blood candles} and sending them straight to Hel.

The Soul Burner Features

Oath of Elimination.name: Oath of Elimination
Oath of Elimination.description:
The Oath of Elimination binds a dour destroyer wholly to the service of entropy, focusing on the destruction of immortal adversaries that seek to cheat entropy.

Tenets of Elimination

Though the exact words and strictures of the oath vary, dour destroyers of this oath share these tenets:

All shall be dust. Dour destroyers are expected to hunt down and eliminate all creatures that seek to cheat death, rendering them a foe to undead and the mirthful dødelig in particular as well as certain outsiders and similar immortal creatures.

I shall not let my passions guide me. While all shall be dust in the end, dour destroyers seek to be as passionless as possible, working together even with loathed adversaries to bring down liches and similar creatures that seek to cheat death.

I shall not prolong my life, for I welcome becoming dust. Dour destroyers may accept healing and heal themselves, but they may not engage in any practice that prolongs their lifespan, nor may they return from the dead without losing access to all class abilities until they make atonement for the violation of their oath.

Oath of Elimination Features

Path of the Primordial Predator.name: Path of the Primordial Predator
Path of the Primordial Predator.description:
The traditions of @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.oKvTwxNml1CsFhbG]{kraidyl} hunters are the same as those of their reptilian ancestors—deadly speed, patient stealth, fierce savagery, and brutal force. While the hunters of the Underworld are wont to follow many primitive paths, most embrace the ways of their past and become primordial predators, supplementing their powerful physical forms with ancient tactics that epitomize why it is these scions of death are so feared.

Path of the Primordial Predator Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.eY2IeiSBO9MDm983]{Savage Jaws}

Path of the Fungal Hulk.name: Path of the Fungal Hulk
Path of the Fungal Hulk.description:
For some @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.NT1fCmCuo7SesTAi]{funglets}, rage is as much a metabolic choice as an emotional one—these are the fungal hulks and even standing next to one can be a dire proposal.

Path of the Fungal Hulk Features

Verdant Bloom.title: Verdant Bloom
Verdant Bloom.hint: You learn to manipulate the type of plant matter you are shedding.

Svirf Scientist.name: Svirf Scientist
Svirf Scientist.description:
Despite the tumultuous history your race has with technology, you carry on with inventing new devices, consequences be damned! Magic is of course the means to your scientific pursuits, but the attainment of knowledge about and mastery of the natural world is your ultimate goal. Let other mages use gems to control magic—your expertise lay in utilizing mechanical devices to similar ends with the hopes that someday you'll strike on a huge discovery, the kind that would ensure the prosperity of svirfneblin in Aventyr for ages to come.

Svirf Scientist Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.QMqH2j16P1VzcOWS]{It's Science!} @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.nTFLAcirvMo13tHt]{Academic Fieldworker}

Svirf Science.title: Svirf Science
Svirf Science.hint: You learn three tricks of svirf science of your choice, which are detailed under "Svirf Science" below. Many types of svirf science enhance another action in some way. You can use only one svirf science trick per attack. You learn two additional svirf science tricks of your choice at 7th, 10th and 15th level. Each time you learn a new svirf science, you can also replace one svirf science you know with a different one. You are proficient with all types of svirf science you know.

Hoyrall Shredder.name: Hoyrall Shredder
Hoyrall Shredder.description:
"It was horrible—suddenly, these small insectoid things started coming at us—and when Bjarn fired an arrow, things turned ugly. One of them transformed into a whirling ball of blades, impervious to damage, destroying anything in its path. Nothing could hit it... "

There is huge potential within the four-armed nature of the @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.racial-features-urc.OiA3LnjgHXSR0pso]{hoyrall}, but mortal bodies and minds, even alien, insectoid ones, tend to have problems when trying to coordinate more than two weapons in the chaos of melee combat. Still, there are those exceedingly dexterous individuals that manage this feat, becoming whirlwinds of destruction. As you follow the path of the hoyrall shredder, you become increasingly adept at making your 4 arms a nigh-impenetrable wall of defense or a storm of severing slashes.

Hoyrall Shredder Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.SzPaJqxxXgCguqQn]{Multi-Arm Specialist}

7th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.oDKAI0lfdpD1JkWs]{Web of Steel}

Oath of Despair.name: Oath of Despair
Oath of Despair.description:
The Oath of Despair focuses on the disintegration of the illusions that provide solace and comfort to the creatures of the mortal planes. You spread despair and your dread world-view, eroding the will of the unfortunates that cross your path.

Tenets of Despair

Though the exact words and strictures of the oath vary, dour destroyers of this oath share these tenets:

I do not believe in hope and shall make others see the futility of their resistance. Dour destroyers genuinely believe that ceasing to struggle and embracing extinction is the noble thing to do—hope is considered an anathema to them.

I place no value on baubles and fleeting flesh, for all is dust. Dour destroyers are expected to lead a minimalist lifestyle; while gorging oneself on the spoils of war is perfectly acceptable, the constant disintegration of finery, jewels etc. just shows the ephemeral nature of being and vices should never be the focus of their quests.

There is no beauty, only dust. Dour destroyers are expected to destroy art and means of creating art when they encounter it; anything that lifts the spirits of others is a hindrance towards the eventual transition to dust.

Oath of Despair Features

3rd Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.Jiswcmnde4yDISiS]{Accelerated Decay}

7th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.8UbpJ36qoRygJaM7]{Nimbus of Decay}

15th Level: @UUID[Compendium.underworld-races-and-classes.class-features-urc.r3kt1lBfS62EF1Ip]{Sticks and Stones}
